page.title: 16THE ELDERLY
page.content: The elderly make up approximately one third of the population of these villages, living in private and council houses and old peoples bungalows. State pensions are Â£56.00 per week for a married couple, payable at a local post office. Because of the longer life-span, provision is made for health care by doctors, nurses and geriatric health visitors from nearby towns. Free chiropody at home, day centres or local hospitals, private or state residential homes,together with home helps and meals on wheels are all available. Social facilities include Over 60's Club, The Royal British Legion and for the more active, bowling and tennis clubs. The mobile library calls every fortnight and there is a bus service to neighbouring towns with the provision of free bus tokens.
